Animal rights activists would have more power to influence legislation and public opinion, potentially leading to significant changes in the way animals are treated in society.
Animals would be protected by laws that would prevent cruelty and abuse, and they would have the right to seek medical attention and protection from harm.
Animals would be able to own property and have the same legal rights as humans, including the right to a fair trial and the right to seek compensation for harm done to them.
Animals would have the right to vote and participate in the political process, potentially leading to more animal-friendly policies and laws.
Animals would have the right to seek asylum from humans who are abusing or mistreating them, and they would have the right to live in a safe and protected environment.
